name: resoak
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to soak something (= make it very wet or leave it in liquid) again, for a second, third, etc. time: Drain the solution, and then resoak the cucumbers in fresh water for one hour. The clay is soaked in water for five hours; it is then skimmed and resoaked until it is clean.
More examplesFewer examplesThe sticks burned quickly, and every 15 minutes they needed to be re-soaked from a jar of oil.To deter moths, put wooden balls soaked in cedar oil in your cupboards. These need to be re-soaked regularly.The matting holds water well and only needs resoaking every couple of days.
